tripreview.Title: "Thick fog completely obscured the view, yet still worth the trip up"
tripreview.sentence: We set out when it was sunny, but our Tempo got a flat tire on the way, and by the time we arrived the fog was so thick you could not see anything.
However, there is a tiny village here populated with the people that make a living from selling fruit, snacks, etc.
The fog made the place seem mysterious and atmospheric !
I took some great photos.
Also, the views of the mountains and tea plantations (and plantation workers) on the way up were great.
There is a small fee charged to access the station.
Apart from the views on the drive and at the top (if you're lucky), people watching, and photography, there is nothing to do up here, so maybe skip if you are pressed for time.

If you do go, be careful of any puddles and the shacks offering toilet facilities (which were very clean, by the way) - a leech crawled underneath my sandal strap and I didn't realize until it had let go.

tripreview.Title: "it all depends on the weather"
tripreview.sentence: We arrived early and if we'd been 10 minutes later we wouldn't have seen a thing due to the clouds.
Obviously there's nothing you can do about this, so just come prepared!
There are lots of little stalls in the area selling food but it's a shame so much rubbish has been dumped in such a lovely spot.

tripreview.Title: "Go on a clear day"
tripreview.sentence: This is the best journey of the munnar trip.
we can experince a memorable drive through the tea gardens and once you reach there, you can see the valley, beautiful landscape.

tripreview.Title: "Hot expereince"
tripreview.sentence: It may be due to we visited it in March.
But really nothing new aas compared to MOunt Abu for Gujarati visiter.
Dont waste your energy and time here.
Rather spend beautiful evening in Munnar itself.

tripreview.Title: "Top Station - Terrible"
tripreview.sentence: First walk to that place is lousy and difficult and also the stairs are so steep that one can fall down.
View is just average.

tripreview.Title: "Very good views"
tripreview.sentence: The place is the highest view point in munnar.
However, getting there takes a quite a bit of time, the place itself is very far then there is a small hike that has to be done in order to reach the place.

tripreview.Title: "Superb place that I have ever visited till now"
tripreview.sentence: Its a pretty nice place to see.
A must to see place among the list of places in munnar.
The view is fabulous atop the hill.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing view"
tripreview.sentence: This is the highest point in Munnar.
The view is amazing and the journey is worth making the efforts.

tripreview.Title: "A spot with a Great View"
tripreview.sentence: The drive to the location itself was excellent with some great stop overs.
The top station is a must visit for nature lovers.
The top station is a must visit for nature lovers.

tripreview.Title: ""Excellent view""
tripreview.sentence: Top station provides nice view but its little far from the parking.
It will be difficult for the older peoples to visit.

tripreview.Title: "Top of the hill"
tripreview.sentence: it was at some height but gave nice view of mountains covered by tea gardens.

tripreview.Title: "It was Good"
tripreview.sentence: It was a good walk to the top station.
Along the walk there were some stalls that we had fried maggie.
The taste was more than just delicious.
I am planning my next trip again in March 2016 and I am gonna get there just for the fried maggie.
Excellent!

tripreview.Title: "This is a Hike, lots of stairs etc"
tripreview.sentence: One should go, it can be cleaner, no one is maintaining the area.
There are not many places you can go for using toilet facilities, we had to use one of the restaurants in a lodge.

tripreview.Title: ""A bit hyped location""
tripreview.sentence: Good place to trek only.
You have to walk more than 2-3 km
there are so may stairs
there are some small shops selling tea, and lime juice
Poor tourist spot make you tired rather than you enjoy.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful views, but your luck if you get to see them!"
tripreview.sentence: It is a long drive to this point from Munnar, but if the clouds/mist comes in you may not be able to see anything.
It also is rather windy and cold so good to bring some warm clothing.

tripreview.Title: "A small trek for a non-lazy holidayer"
tripreview.sentence: Firstly there isn't much to see, but its a nice small trek, which makes the holiday better than just see things from your van, eat and sleep like holiday.
The scenery is ofcourse beautiful, and worth the little entry fee that one needs to pay.
And because we were a group of friends, we enjoyed every bit of it/.

tripreview.Title: "Again a luck based location"
tripreview.sentence: It is the highest point of Munnar about 1700 mtr.
The scenic beauty from this place is best.
You can enjoy hot drinks over there.
Make sure you place some warm clothes at top.
If you are lucky then there will be no fog!

tripreview.Title: "Amazing view from this place"
tripreview.sentence: Please carry extra warm clothes if you plan ur trip in dec
its more than chilling cold
If you are planning to drive then do not take the udumalpet-munnar road

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful nature view"
tripreview.sentence: Top Station is tourist destination in the Kannan Devan hills of Tamil Nadu.
It is part of the places of Tourist interest in Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "The journey is equally good as the destination"
tripreview.sentence: The top station is a spot located on a hill top with loads of curvy roads.
the whole journey to the top of the hills is breathtaking.

tripreview.Title: "Great views.. little filthy"
tripreview.sentence: This place has a lot of amazing views.
Although the views are elusive if you go in winter when the fog rolls in here randomly.
But it makes the place that much more beautiful.
The one detracting thing is the mess made by the various vendors.

Its nice to be able to enjoy a snack or local fruits or piping hot tea while there, but the vendors have no place to dispose of the trash they generate and seem to throw it down the side of the mountain.
If that continues it will be a disaster.

tripreview.Title: "Beware the Fog!"
tripreview.sentence: Although Munnar is littered with beautiful viewpoints, Top Station is said to be the best among them.
Unfortunately, I do not know if that's true, because the Fog obscured everything from my view.
If you go, go early in the day to avoid the evening fog!

tripreview.Title: "Fabulous views"
tripreview.sentence: The climb is worth the effort, if you can't manage the steps it's still good and you will enjoy the view.
Don't go if you get motion sickness as the access road is long and windy.

tripreview.Title: "Highest point at munnar!!"
tripreview.sentence: Top station offers one of the best views in all of munnar.
Top Station the highest point in munnar after anaimudi peak of course.
To reach top station, proceed along the top station highway from munnar town.

This route offers many sightseeing options starting from rose garden, photo point, elephant park, mattupetty dam, speed boating park, indo-swiss dairy farm, echo point, kundala dam and finally top station.
Reaching top station is only possible from 6 am to 6 pm.
After 6 pm, there are restrictions to enter as the mattupetty forest checkpost may close.
The actual place is now overcrowded with street vendors selling many many things, tea shops and small eateries are frequent.
There was only one hotel accommodation available.
Tents are available for overnight stay on request and payment.
To enter the view point, there is a separate entry charge.
Around Rs 25 for adults.
Getting down to the view point requires climbing down many steps, its not a problem, but climbing back up these steps is really difficult.
One will easily run of breath.
So, climb slowly and carefully.
Not advised during rainy season.
The best time to visit is before 10 am.
It offers spectacular views of neighbouring tamil nadu.
If lucky, with binoculars we can even see wild animals grazing.
After 10 am it may or may not become misty, depends on ones luck.
After 3-4 pm, it becomes fully misty, we wont be able to see anything at all.
Its pretty chilly here, so senior citizens and asthmatics need to take care.

tripreview.Title: "Great Experiance"
tripreview.sentence: To be frank, the rating i give here is not fully for top station or its view, It is for the way to Top Station.
It will be just an amazing experience of you travel in bike that too ride around 7am to 8am morning.
The bone breaking chillness will almost make you freeze and feels wonderful.
I loved the way to top station.
A must visit place.

tripreview.Title: "Worth going if its a no mist day !"
tripreview.sentence: If you are lucky and its a no mist day by the time you reach top station, you will get excellent view from here.
Unfortunately it was a full mist day when we visited this point.

tripreview.Title: "Up above the world so high..."
tripreview.sentence: Top Station offers a panoramic view of the majestic Western Ghats, if you are lucky enough to not encounter a thick sea of clouds.
Tourists, beware.
It is a pleasant trek down to the view-point, but can get really tiring on the way up the many broad stairs.
But if the cloud cover is less, it is really worth all the effort.

tripreview.Title: "For the mountain pass experience only"
tripreview.sentence: Only with a lot of luck, you'll enjoy a magnificient view on the surrounding mountains.
The rest of the time, clouds cling on them, and you're happy that the local tea shop displays photos of what you have missed

tripreview.Title: "Good View point ..."
tripreview.sentence: Have no great expectations.
Its a good view point but definitely not the best.
You can spend about half an hour go for a walk into the tea gardens take some pics.
Its serene.

tripreview.Title: "Long distance "
tripreview.sentence: From munnar above 35kms but view is good it's chennai border.

tripreview.Title: "Greenery and scenery place"
tripreview.sentence: It was awesome view from top of Munnar with average options of food but good place for trekking.
During my visit, weather was cool but not fog or shivering hence views were excellent.
Maggi and fruits were taken by family.

tripreview.Title: "Top station"
tripreview.sentence: Its an hour drive from munnar .
the route is beautiful.
Top station has some breathtaking views there is fresh air and cold breeze the walk to the ticket counter is long but has some nice stalls selling spices chocklates and fruits .

tripreview.Title: "Went their twice and both times it was covered with Fog."
tripreview.sentence: Went there in 2010 and 2015 and both times couldn't see anything as fog had enveloped the area.
Journey to reach the place is awesome with many awe-inspiring views of the valley and hills.

tripreview.Title: "My visit to top station"
tripreview.sentence: The road to top station is full of scenic green art and tea plantations.
It was raining and cloudy when we visited.
All around there was fog like clouds we could not get any view of the valley from top of the hill.
But had the pleasure of walking within clouds.
Did not like the road from parking to top point.
It needs maintainance.

tripreview.Title: "Heaven on earth.."
tripreview.sentence: Its a heaven on earth with a breathtaking views amazing nature, fresh air, cold breeze, with a little rain.
When we visit it was little bit rainy in december.
It was all covered with heavy fog.
A site you should visit once.

tripreview.Title: "Awesome place but view depends on the density of fog"
tripreview.sentence: The place is just excellent and cold.
View depends on the density of fog.
You should have car or bike to see this place.

tripreview.Title: "Defensively worth a trip"
tripreview.sentence: The views you get are incredible, defenitely worth going all the way to the top.
There are some little stalls along the way too.

tripreview.Title: "Most amazing view ever "
tripreview.sentence: I was wondering this is India or some other country when I visited this place.

tripreview.Title: "Simply Spectacular!!!"
tripreview.sentence: Wow!
superb place with chilling weather.
Hot Coffee and tea is a must to try not at restaurants but the small shops around.
It might look dirty but no worries.
The tea comes in mini paper cups.
Otherwise be careful when driving down at night due to heavy fog, the path might be alittle tricky if ur a tourist and driving on unfamiliar roads.

tripreview.Title: "Sooo beautiful "
tripreview.sentence: Amazing amazing amazing and so amazing.
Loved the place and to be in nature's lap.
People are lucky who are serving there.
No pollution and so pure.

tripreview.Title: "Breathtaking view"
tripreview.sentence: Its an hour from Munnar but the route is beautiful and the view from the Top is breathtaking.
Don't pay at the point to go down 100 steps for the view, just get the view from the route.
It's the same.

tripreview.Title: "The place on earth to visit if you are in this part of earth :)"
tripreview.sentence: This is 'THE PLACE' to visit if you in love with scenic views.
You have to see it to believe it.
It is beyond words to describe this place as eyes feast on its beauty.
Depending on what time u visit, if its cloudy have patience and do not leave without seeing the 360 degree veiw.
Every nook and corner is full of feast to eyes.
You feel like you are on top of the world.

tripreview.Title: "Not really worth the drive"
tripreview.sentence: This is a nice enough view, but not particularly different to anywhere else in the vicinity, especially as it is often cloudy.
You just pull over at the side of the road near a tea plantation which you can wander around, and there is just one small van selling chai.
It is nice enough, but not really any different to lots of views across Munnar.
And it isn't even the highest peak - that isn't accessible by car but it is by jeep, so perhaps that is a better option?

tripreview.Title: "In the mist"
tripreview.sentence: A really good cup of tea at the cafe and amazing views for about 30 seconds before the mists rolled in.
Well worth a visit.

tripreview.Title: "worth all the hardship n legpain lol"
tripreview.sentence: as most of d experienced exprts had intimated dat this place is not really gud for old people i agree but what i saw there was enthusiasm in all age groups to reach the view place.
the scenery is gud but knee problem people plz avoid.
i enjoyed the fresh sweet pineapple n some exclusive fruits which were more tastier thn the exotic fruits too.
i bought hairoil jadibooties as a souvenir.
no more food options so stockup your water n snacks beforehand.
go ahead n enjoy.

tripreview.Title: "Stunning View of Western Ghatt Hills."
tripreview.sentence: Top station gives you a stunning view of western ghat hills, which is very exiting.
Go there by noon, During rainy season the view will be covered by mist.
Comparing the additional journey required reach here, I suspect whether is it worth to go there.

tripreview.Title: "Worth the drive"
tripreview.sentence: It's a long drive and the last bit of the road is quite bad.
However it's worth it.
We reached there just as it rained heavily and we struggled to find parking.
We stayed in our car till it eased a little and ventured out with umbrellas.
After walking along a path lined by small shops we were treated to fantastic views.
The first viewpoint is a cakewalk and easy to access.
The second view station is a bit of a walk but again, it is worth it.
The setting is serene and calm and you are treated to majestic mountains and deep valleys.
Some mist and clouds are floated in and it felt great.
The walk back needs some effort but we left very happy.
Please avoid littering in this area and respect other peoples privacy.
The shopkeepers will share a few stories and anecdotes if you strike a conversation with them.

tripreview.Title: "Top Most Point"
tripreview.sentence: This is the top most point in Munnar and you get a bird's eye view of the region which is surely amazing .
Do not miss the opportunity to be here.

tripreview.Title: "Avoid reaching early there!"
tripreview.sentence: This place is very far from the Munnar, you should choose the timings in such a way that while you reach there, must not very foggy/ very early.
We were reached there at 8:30 AM, therefore we could not find any view due to fog, Entry fee is Rs 50 per adult.

tripreview.Title: "Must watch"
tripreview.sentence: If you are planning a trip to Munnar, then you must place 'Top station' in your list as the first item.
Some times visibility falls to "0" due to fog.
Travel to the top station itself gives a lot of pleasure because of good scenery and climate.
A must watch.

tripreview.Title: ""Close to the clouds""
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful spot, absolute scenic beauty.
Wonderful location, must visit for people visiting Munnar.
You can actually touch the clouds from here, well maintained tea garden and the clouds excite us when the cool breeze coming directly from clouds.

tripreview.Title: "Good only on a sunny day else avoid"
tripreview.sentence: This place is good only on sunny day else you will not be able to see anything in the fog.
Last point of the tour but better if you come to this place in the beginning of the tour.

tripreview.Title: "testing on ur knees"
tripreview.sentence: twice to this place.
way to this place is awesome.
once u reach there be sure tht ur knees are in good condition otherwise think twice before u venture.
a kilometer walk will take u to the entrance of a descend with some 60-100 steps.
coupled with the cold climate u may find yourself both in want of air and legs
good for young,the youthful old, and the good shaped middle aged and tasking for the obese and sedentary of all ages and the real old

tripreview.Title: "Well!"
tripreview.sentence: Not what I expected.
Views are breathtaking!
Weather was dreadful!
I wish tourists realized that they can feed the hungry ponies corn husks!
They are so grateful.

tripreview.Title: "Misty"
tripreview.sentence: Its a view spot.
Make sure you should visit the top station before 2:30 pm ,After 3pm its very misty and nothing we could be able to see through the mist.

tripreview.Title: "Vacation days with family"
tripreview.sentence: Echo Point is situated around 13 km from the town of Munnar.
Apart from an Echo point, the place is also a picnic spot where visitors love to take nature walks along the hill slopes.
Tourists can also trek in the nearby tea, coffee and spice plantations.
The cool breeze and serene surroundings makes this place favorite among wayfarers.

tripreview.Title: "Be at the heaven !!!"
tripreview.sentence: Really great to be there !
An astonishing view which gives us a feeling that we are at heaven.
No words to stay, can feel the real beauty of nature

tripreview.Title: "Not on a foggy day"
tripreview.sentence: There is no point on going to the hill station on the foggy day, as you will not see anything.
The final walk from the parking is not very pleasant - stalls selling fruits, tea, coffea and souvenirs.
The entrance is 50 INR for a foreigner + additional 20 for a camera.
It might look beatufiul on a sunny day, but we didn't have a chance to check it.

tripreview.Title: "Just amazing,breathtaking view"
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful view,just an amazing experience.
It was as close to heaven as I could be, the cool breeze, clear blue sky and breathtaking view.

tripreview.Title: "Breathtaking view of vally"
tripreview.sentence: There are two phases of this point and each one is 500 M walk and stepping down.
It gives a breath taking view of the Vally and experience is one of the unique one.
This falls under tamilnadu and hence gives you to visit two states for one point.

tripreview.Title: "good place but not good price"
tripreview.sentence: Good place to visit but too expensive to go in.
We didn't see a lot this time because it was cloudy day, but generally good feeling after.

tripreview.Title: "Nothing to look for"
tripreview.sentence: This place has nothing.
Just road along the hills covered with clouds.
The road was filled with horse dung.
We were disappointed after reaching here.
Waste of time.
Better avoid this place.

tripreview.Title: "The top sight in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: Incredible view!
Take the public bus (around 40 rupee) up to the top.
There's one every hour and stops at the lakes, dams, and echo point song the way.

tripreview.Title: "Overrated"
tripreview.sentence: We were expecting some calmness and unspoilt nature at such high altitude.
But all u get is thelas serving omlette and fruits which makes this place dirty.
U have to pay 25rs to reach one specific view point after climbing down 251 stairs (yes!
I counted them while climbing back up) which is not very impressive.
If u are looking for unspoilt natural beauty go to ervikulam national park.

tripreview.Title: "Average view"
tripreview.sentence: Top station is at top as it's name says.
Always this point is covered with fog and clouds, visibility is very poor or less in all seasons.
A good place to hangout with friends, family and for couple for few hours.

tripreview.Title: "Great view"
tripreview.sentence: nice to go to top station must visit place when going to Munnar really beautiful scenic place It's 35 km from Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Good View, but little hectic to reach the final spot"
tripreview.sentence: The ticket to this place is 25rp.
there are lots of steps to cover to reach the final spot which is ok for 1 side.
The problem is when we travel back, we have to climb all the steps which was little too much for us.
There is a stopping point which is at 20% of the distance to final spot to people who cant proceed.
Here also we can experience some cool views.
There is a resting place also here.
That aside, the view at final spot was very good, can feel fresh air etc.
It is a good place if you have good stamina.
Overall it was good.
Wont say, it is a must see!

tripreview.Title: "Mesmerizing View!"
tripreview.sentence: From Munnar ,this place is about 35 KM top .
This is must visit place in munnar .
I would suggest to visit here early morning so to enjoy the beauty of this top View and enjoy a Chill morning.
I believe they have tent camping facility on top for the people who love more adventure .

tripreview.Title: "Scenic view"
tripreview.sentence: This is must visit place in trip to Munnar.
View of cloud clad mountains are very eye soothing.
Though difficult for children and elderly people to climb up and down the steps.
Same view can also be experienced on the way to Top station.

tripreview.Title: "Stunning"
tripreview.sentence: The views were breathtaking.
It was very peaceful and tranquil.
One of the highlights of our trip.
Just beware, you have to be in good shape, there are lots of stairs!

tripreview.Title: "Trash filled and stalls all along the walk"
tripreview.sentence: Nothing peaceful or idyllic about this point.
The view does not astound you because you saw it the whole drive up.
Trash lines the walk with all the stalls trying to sell you stuff as you dodge excrement on the path.

tripreview.Title: "Munnar top station visit"
tripreview.sentence: This place is like heaven, you can feel the clouds travelling through and fresh air brings your inner soul in peace.
It is the Highest point in munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Breathtaking valley views"
tripreview.sentence: This place has breathtaking views of the whole valley ahead.
If possible, do go down to the last point on the trail, but keep in mind the climb back is quite strenuous.

tripreview.Title: "I felt like on top of the world"
tripreview.sentence: It was awesome standing at such a height and looking all around, to neighbouring Tamilnadu.
the view is out of the world.

tripreview.Title: "Right on Top"
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful view of Munnar from the Top station.
My husband went on to mention that the views beat those he witnessed in Scotland.

tripreview.Title: "Nice"
tripreview.sentence: A long walk from drop point but the weather was enchanting, we couldnt see much due to heavy fog, but the experience was nice.

tripreview.Title: "What a view!"
tripreview.sentence: This was perhaps the place to visit in Munnar and boy are we glad we didnt miss it!
Initially our driver refused to take us there stating that the place falls under Tamil Nadu and without proper permit, we wont be able go there.
Anyone can visit the top point without any permit.
The drive is long, close to 20 kms and road is long and winding.
Once you reach the place, the car has to be parked a certain distance aay from the entry point which can be an incovenience if its raining.
We reached the entry point and had to pay Rs 25 per person for entry.
after that, there is a lot descent before you reach the view point.
from there you can view Tamil Nadu and western Ghats and all around, majestic mountains covered in clouds and mist.
When we reached, it was raining and hence a huge part of the valley was covered under mist.
It was so thick, that the visibility was down to a few mtrs only.
Hence avoid going to this place if it has recently rained or it is too cold.
We didnt have a good view initially, but later on, it started to rain which cleared quite a bit of mist and then winds also dispersed quite a bit to clear the valley for a magnificent view.
This is a must visit place in Munnar.
Also, try the various fruits on offer there like Tomato, Passionfruit, Shareefa etc.

tripreview.Title: "wide view of natural beauty in munnar"
tripreview.sentence: greenary peaks, hills, valleys.
way in the middle of tea gardens, evergreen forests.
if it is a sunny day, u can see the horizon

tripreview.Title: "Nice "
tripreview.sentence: It was November.
the place is maintained a bit more than whwr has happened to other tourist destinations in India
still lot of room for improvement as far as maintainance and safety is concerned.
but this place has its own beuty which is unparalleled.
i have been to europe as well .
the only difference is that we lag behind in the maintenance and safety of the places

tripreview.Title: "Lots to see, but somewhat crowded with diesel spewing vehicles"
tripreview.sentence: It enjoyable six hours leisurely tour.
Lots of places to stop including two areas where you're likely to see grazing elephants, a lovely tea spot with spectacular flower gardens overlooking the second, higher lake.
The self titled boats on the higher lake worth the cost for a half an hour paddle around the reservoir.
View from top station south east to the plains of Tamil Nadu worth the trek.
Suggest stopping at upper tea plantations for views, quiet, and fresh air.

tripreview.Title: "awesome view but filled with mist and fog"
tripreview.sentence: This place is about 25km from munnar and local taxi drivers will take you there saying it is really a good view and you can see tamil nadu from the top.
While the view is magnificient, you won't be able to see tamil nadu down the valley as it is mostly always filled with mist.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent View"
tripreview.sentence: Munnar is one of the heaven in Kerala.
The view from top station is beautiful.
there is a vegetarian restaurant near to the top station, they serve good veg food.

tripreview.Title: "A must visit at Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: Its a must visit place at Munnar where you can find mist around the year.
You need to buy tickets to the view point and walk down approx 100 mtrs to have the best view.
Steps are build to ease the walk.
Lots of small shops available with fruits and water.
Parking is available, but its best to park before reaching the destination, as parking inside is messy.

tripreview.Title: "The heaven"
tripreview.sentence: When i reached there it was very clear for the whole view but suddenly within seconds the fog came out and covered the whole place.
Now i wonder if i was standing in the cloudz.
Its was like freezing there.
Trecking is possible there.
And the most beautiful thing is that we can see a bunch of mountains from there
its a wonderful view and cannot take the eyes

tripreview.Title: "Great View"
tripreview.sentence: The top station in Munnar give a good view of great mountains.
We can see the tamil nadu from this view with lot of wind mills.
You must visit Top staion when go to Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Have tea at top station!!!"
tripreview.sentence: When i visited with family
It was cold, rainy and full of fog in October
Nice Spot for a lil tea n do not miss the exotic tropical fruits they sell
passion fruits for 7 rupees
its a very high view point but worth all the travel !

tripreview.Title: "Visit only if you must"
tripreview.sentence: First of all, there are 262 steps that you need to climb down to get to this point.
Second, if there is mist, there is absolutely nothing you will see.
Third, even if you are able to see stuff, tea gardens are far more picturesque than this destination.

tripreview.Title: "Top of the world!"
tripreview.sentence: Amazing view.
We saw many huffing and puffing on the way up.
It is really worth the trek.
But you really need to be lucky to get a clear view.
Most of the times it is closed.
There is no place to rest at second station if it rains.
